dialogue: Your Eminence...
Oh dear God, one of them’s died.
What?
Have we lost a Cardinal?
I’ll have a transcript made of the text from the tape, Em inence. If there’s nothing else...
I need you to do something for me. Monsignor Morales. I’m sure he’s still in Rome. Could you try and see him? Use my authority.
Today? I...I could try, your Eminence?
I need to know what happened in the final meeting between the Holy Father and Cardinal Tremblay.
Of course, Eminence.
Bless you.
I could try and speak to Monsignor Morales again? See if I could find out any more?
No, no... This is all so... unseemly.
You go on, Ray.
The Holy Father’s turtles. He was very fond of them. A gift from Angola.
There’s been an explosion your Eminence. In the Piazza Barberini.
Dear God. A bomb?
It’s unclear at this moment. There are injuries but no talk of fatalities so far.
Say nothing to the cardinal- electors about this Ray. We are sequestered and t hey must be shielded from any news of the outside world in case it influences their judgement. You understand?
Of course your Eminence.
Yes, Ray?
The incident this morning, your Eminence. I have more information, if...?
No, Ray. I too must be shielded from any knowledge which could act as an...interference in the process of this Conclave.
Of course, Eminence.
Anything else?

Uhh...Oh, Cardinal Benitez. His health problems? He was issued with a return ticket to Geneva, paid for from the Pope’s own account. I checked the visa application. The purpose for travel was given as “medical treatment.” Anyway, whatever it was, it can’t have been serious. The tickets were cancelled. He never went.
Alright. Thank you, Ray.
